item.title: Israel recognizes 3 illegal West Bank outposts, advances construction of 5,295 homes - The Times of Israel
item.description:
1. Israel recognizes 3 illegal West Bank outposts, advances construction of 5,295 homes  The Times of Israel
  2. Israel approves largest West Bank land seizure in three decades, rights group says  CNN
  3. Israel approves plans for nearly 5,300 new homes in West Bank settlements  PBS NewsHour
  4. Israel said to approve largest W Bank land seizure in decades  BBC.com
  5. Israel approves three settlement outposts, thousands of homes in West Bank  Al Jazeera English

item.title: Suella Braverman apologizes for her Conservative Party
Nigel Farage’s Reform UK secures first-ever Parliamentary seat, marks major shift in British politics
UK election live news: Mordaunt, Shapps, Coffey and Keegan out in Tory bloodbath as Starmer says it’s time for Labour ‘to deliver’
item.description:
Starmer set to enter No 10 with commanding majority as senior Tories beaten but Labour’s Ashworth and Debbonaire lose seats

  • UK general election results 2024: live tracker
  • Full story: Exit poll shows Starmer on course for huge win
  • What time will we know who won? Guide to the night

Clive Myrie is opening the BBC’s election night coverage. He is co-presenting with Laura Kuenssberg.

No 10 has also announced knightoods for four Tories in the dissolution honours – Oliver Dowden, the deputy PM; Julian Smith, the former chief whip and Northern Ireland secretary; Ben Wallace, the former defence secretary; and Alister Jack, the outgoing Scottish secretary – and one damehood, for Thérèse Coffey, the former deputy PM.

Continue reading...

item.title: Scottish Labour ‘confident of majority’ as SNP faces Westminster wipeout
item.description:
Anas Sarwar says he believes his party will win a majority of the 57 seats in Scotland while Sturgeon says numbers are at ‘grimmer end of expectations’

  • General election 2024: live news
  • UK general election results live tracker
  • When will we know who won? Hour-by-hour election night guide

The leader of Scottish Labour has said he is confident of a full revival with early indications they will inflict heavy losses on the Scottish National party in Glasgow, Edinburgh and Fife.

Arriving at the Glasgow count centre, Anas Sarwar received rapturous applause from candidates anticipating imminent declarations of their success.

Continue reading...

item.title: Angela Rayner cheers breakthrough as Labour set for historic victory
item.description:
Deputy leader praises Keir Starmer, while Wes Streeting says forecast result would be remarkable recovery from 2019

  • General election 2024: live news
  • UK general election results live tracker
  • When will we know who won? Hour-by-hour election night guide

Labour will be the largest party in England, Wales and Scotland for the first time in more than two decades, as Keir Starmer prepares to enter government within hours, taking seats from a string of cabinet ministers and high-profile Conservatives.

But the party suffered several significant losses to independent candidates, including the defeat of the shadow cabinet minister Jonathan Ashworth, who lost his Leicester South seat to a pro-Gaza independent candidate, and the re-election of ex-leader Jeremy Corbyn as an independent.

Continue reading...

item.title: UK general election 2024: five key points
item.description:
Keir Starmer’s Labour looks to be heading for power with a large majority as voters punish Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives

  • General election 2024: live news
  • UK general election results live tracker
  • When will we know who won? Hour-by-hour election night guide

Keir Starmer, the leader of the opposition Labour party, is on track to take over from Rishi Sunak as UK prime minister with the most emphatic election victory by any British political party this century.

Initial results overnight, backed up by a nationwide exit poll, indicated Labour would comfortably win an overall majority, returning the left of centre party to government for the first time since 2010.

Continue reading...
